the ground, and maintain the integrity of underground aquifers.
- A cement/bentonite-based grouting between borehole and the casing to seal the borehole to
prevent any fluid movement, reinforce the hole against pressure.
These Terms of Reference provide the technical description and requirements for the Work
Tasks that shall be performed by the Contractor.
3

[Page 23]
2. Rehabilitating of the Existing Borehole (LOT 1)
Steps to rehabilitating the existing borehole include;
- Cleaning the borehole by pumping water and mud if exists
This step is important for following steps.
- Inspect the borehole and casing with camera
Inspecting the borehole with a camera is important to understand the status of the borehole
and casing before taking any actions.
- Cleaning and sealing the casing
The casing shall be scraped, brushed, and emptied of all fluids and loose solids.
- Cementing of the bottom of the Well
In order to stop water entry from the bottom of the Well, shall be cemented with high-early
strength cement (Portland type III).
- Borehole leak test:
All tools and equipment required for successful completion of the test, including but not
limited to, air compressors, valves, air pressure gauges and fittings, are to be provided by
the contractor.
1. Wait 24 hours to allow cement and sealant to cure completely.
2. Fill the borehole to the top with water.
3. Seal the top of the borehole and pressurize the top air pocket to a minimum of 1,304 kPa
(150 psi).
4. Leave the borehole pressurized for 24 hours.
5. Check and record the pressure after 24 hours.
a. If the pressure has not dropped, proceed to step 7.
b. If the pressure has dropped (to account for water and pipe temperature stabilization),
bring the pressure back up to 1,304 kPa (150 psi) and leave the borehole for another 24
hours.
6. Check and record the pressure after an additional 24 hours. There should be no drop in
pressure after 48 hours.
7. Drain the water from the borehole and ensure that it is dry and clear of debris.
2.1 Contractor Responsibilities during Borehole Rehabilitating
a) The Contractor shall be prepared for any situation that might occur during rehabilitating of
the borehole. The contractor must have sufficient equipment and supplies on location. The
Contractor must have sufficient cement on hand and a proper pump in order to cement off
any loss of circulation zones.
4

[Page 24]
b) The Contractor will take care of property and removal of debris from the site. Care shall be
taken at all times during the work described in these specifications to prevent undue
damage to the property on which the work is being performed. After completion of the
work described in this specification, the area shall be thoroughly cleaned of all residual
material resulting from the operation or equipment. The surface shall be free of mud,
cuttings, scrap equipment, foliage, packing, and related items. The surface shall be
smoothed to its original contours with all vehicle ruts covered.
c) The Contractor will keep the Commission fully informed of the progress, or any problems
encountered, during the work or cementation process.
d) The Contractor shall be responsible for ensuring that the requirements of water-tightness,
and quality of cementation indicated in these TOR.
2.2 Reporting
After the completion of the work, the Contractor will submit the Report, providing a full
account of the activities, any problems encountered during the work, The Contractor shall
provide to the Commission 2 (two) copies of the Report in English.
3. Drilling a new Borehole (LOT 2)
3.1 Technical Specifications of the Borehole
The Contractor shall select an appropriate site for the drilling inside the station premises.
Required specifications are listed below:
1. Final depth of the cased borehole will be at least 70m below ground level.
2. All required supplies -casings, components, materials, and additional supplies- shall be new
and first grade.
3. The well casing shall extend above the ground about 60cm. The top end must have a sealed
cap or wellhead box to prevent water ingress. For a steel casing, the exposed top section
must be painted or coated to prevent corrosion.
4. Angle of inclination from vertical will not to exceed 2.5 degrees at any point in the
borehole.
5. Casing must be completely round, with no ellipticity; the inner surface of casing must be
smooth with no irregularities such as welds or couplings, which would reduce the inner
diameter.
6. The casing must be well cemented into the ground, from the bottom up.
7. Steel casing with water-tight joints will be installed for the entire length of the borehole.
8. Inner diameter of the casing should be between 12.7 and 17.8 cm (5 and 7 inches) with a
minimum casing wall thickness of 0.62 cm (0.244 inches).
9. A water-tight cement or steel plug should be completely cemented to the bottom of the
borehole.
10. The outer wall of casing should be completely cemented to the rock along the entire length
of the borehole; cementation must ensure high-quality contact between the casing and the
rock walls.
5

[Page 25]
11. The final cased borehole has to admit a test gauge, to be provided by the Contractor, of
similar dimensions to the equipment to be installed at the borehole, approximately 81.2 cm
in length and 9.5 cm in diameter. The exact dimensions, however, will be provided before

-Goal-
Given a text document that is potentially relevant to this activity and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.
Use English as output language.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, use same language as input text. If English, capitalized the name.
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,category]
- entity_description: Comprehensive description of the entity's attributes and activities
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)

2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
- relationship_keywords: one or more high-level key words that summarize the overarching nature of the relationship, focusing on concepts or themes rather than specific details
Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_keywords><|><relationship_strength>)

3. Identify high-level key words that summarize the main concepts, themes, or topics of the entire text. These should capture the overarching ideas present in the document.
Format the content-level key words as ("content_keywords"<|><high_level_keywords>)

4. Return output in English as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.

5. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1:

Entity_types: [person, technology, mission, organization, location]
Text:
while Alex clenched his jaw, the buzz of frustration dull against the backdrop of Taylor's authoritarian certainty. It was this competitive undercurrent that kept him alert, the sense that his and Jordan's shared commitment to discovery was an unspoken rebellion against Cruz's narrowing vision of control and order.

Then Taylor did something unexpected. They paused beside Jordan and, for a moment, observed the device with something akin to reverence. "If this tech can be understood..." Taylor said, their voice quieter, "It could change the game for us. For all of us."

The underlying dismissal earlier seemed to falter, replaced by a glimpse of reluctant respect for the gravity of what lay in their hands. Jordan looked up, and for a fleeting heartbeat, their eyes locked with Taylor's, a wordless clash of wills softening into an uneasy truce.

It was a small transformation, barely perceptible, but one that Alex noted with an inward nod. They had all been brought here by different paths
################

Text: preferred casing material is corrosion-resistant stainless-steel or similar material provides
corrosion protection. The casing minimum wall thickness shall be 6.2 cm (¼ inch). The casing
must be round, straight, free of irregularities and seamless (cast, with no rolled seams). The
total length of the borehole casing shall be made up of sections of any standard length, but
minimum length of sections should be 3 m. Casing string must be made of the same type
(diameter, wall thickness, and composition) of casing section for its total depth.
Before proceeding with drilling the contractor must notify the Commission in writing with
dimensions of the chosen casing. Threaded casing joints using BTC (buttress-threaded
connections) are preferred. All threaded joints should be coated with joint compound and
tightened using sufficient torque. A torque of 1000 foot-pounds is recommended. Any casing
that meets these specifications is acceptable.
Immediately prior to cementing, a turbulent flow of clear water and a cleaning solution shall be
circulated down the casing and up the annulus to clean out any mud and debris that is present to
secure a good cement bond. The casing strings shall be supported approximately 5 m (15 feet)
above the bottom of the hole during cementing of the casing.
3.3.4 Cementation and grouting
The Contractor has the flexibility of selecting a preferred cementation method that will
completely bond the casing string to the rock walls over its entire depth with no voids or
shrinkage. For example, cementation can be accomplished through the casing using a cement
shoe and plunger method, cementation can be done via external grout tubes in the annulus
between the casing and host rock where the casing string is sealed by a welded plate at the
bottom. However, the preferred cementation process is to pump cement grout through the
interior of the casing using a plunger and cement shoe and flush the full volume up the annular
space between the exterior casing wall and the rock to the surface. The cement shoe and collar
7

[Page 27]
will form the cement plug at the bottom of the casing. Typical cement grout composition uses
cement, sand, bentonite (clay), water, and an expansive additive to prevent shrinkage upon
drying.
The borehole shall be cemented from bottom to top. The following procedure is recommended.
Cement slurry with sufficient volume to fill the annulus with at least 25% excess shall be
pumped into the casing. Then a latch down plug shall be inserted into the casing and washed
down with clear water. When the plug reaches the baffle, normally 1,000 pounds per square
inch of pressure should force the latching nose of the plug into the baffle and lock it in place.
Once the plug is seated, all pressure must be released to check for zero back-flow, this will
prove that the one-way valves are holding. When zero back-flow is obtained, the cement slurry
shall be allowed to cure for 24 hours under no pressure before performing any activities that
could disturb the bond, such as blowing or bailing the borehole dry of water or proceeding with
the acceptance tests.
After 24 hours, the casing shall be scraped, brushed, and emptied of all fluids and loose solids.
If the cement level drops in the annular space between the pipe and the hole, additional cement
slurry may be added around the casing directly from the surface. The level of the cement grout
in the annular space between the casing and the rock wall must be monitored during the
hardening process. If the level drops, additional cement grout must be added around the casing
from the top using small feed pipes if necessary.
3.3.5 Construction of borehole well-head and enclosure
A concrete pad around the top of the borehole casing (“well-head”) with a thickness of 10 to
20cm and approximately 1m x 1m in area (if square) or approximately 1mdiameter (if circular)
is to be constructed. In addition, a housing or enclosure around the top of the well-head for
protection against the environment shall be built. This enclosure will provide shelter from
water, snow, theft, small animals, etc. A simple inverted “bin” with a rubber or synthetic gasket,
bolted to the concrete pad, will suffice. The pad must include an L- or U-shaped conduit for the
entry of the signal cable that will be protected under the well-head enclosure.
3.3.6 Site remediation
The Contractor will take care of property and removal of debris from the site. Care shall be
taken at all times during the work described in these specifications to prevent undue damage to
the property on which the work is being performed. After completion of the work described in
this specification, the area shall be thoroughly cleaned of all residual material resulting from the
drilling operation or equipment. The surface shall be free of drilling mud, cuttings, scrap
equipment, foliage, packing, and related items. The surface shall be smoothed to its original
contours with all vehicle ruts covered.
3.4 Acceptance tests.
The Contractor will perform a series of acceptance tests as described below.
3.4.1 Verticality Test:
A final verticality test must be performed in the interior of the casing after cementation.
Measurements should be made of the deviation from the vertical at 15 m depth intervals and at
the base of the borehole.

- entity_description: Comprehensive description of the entity's attributes and activities

[{"role": "user", "content": "-Goal-
Given a text document that is potentially relevant to this activity and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.
Use English as output language.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, use same language as input text. If English, capitalized the name.
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,category]
- entity_description: Comprehensive description of the entity's attributes and activities
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)

2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
- relationship_keywords: one or more high-level key words that summarize the overarching nature of the relationship, focusing on concepts or themes rather than specific details
Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_keywords><|><relationship_strength>)

3. Identify high-level key words that summarize the main concepts, themes, or topics of the entire text. These should capture the overarching ideas present in the document.
Format the content-level key words as ("content_keywords"<|><high_level_keywords>)

4. Return output in English as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.

5. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-

Example 1:

Text:
while Alex clenched his jaw, the buzz of frustration dull against the backdrop of Taylor's authoritarian certainty. It was this competitive undercurrent that kept him alert, the sense that his and Jordan's shared commitment to discovery was an unspoken rebellion against Cruz's narrowing vision of control and order.

Then Taylor did something unexpected. They paused beside Jordan and, for a moment, observed the device with something akin to reverence. "If this tech can be understood..." Taylor said, their voice quieter, "It could change the game for us. For all of us."

The underlying dismissal earlier seemed to falter, replaced by a glimpse of reluctant respect for the gravity of what lay in their hands. Jordan looked up, and for a fleeting heartbeat, their eyes locked with Taylor's, a wordless clash of wills softening into an uneasy truce.

It was a small transformation, barely perceptible, but one that Alex noted with an inward nod. They had all been brought here by different paths

Tension threaded through the dialogue of beeps and static as communications with Washington buzzed in the background. The team stood, a portentous air enveloping them. It was clear that the decisions they made in the ensuing hours could redefine humanity's place in the cosmos or condemn them to ignorance and potential peril.

Their connection to the stars solidified, the group moved to address the crystallizing warning, shifting from passive recipients to active participants. Mercer's latter instincts gained precedence— the team's mandate had evolved, no longer solely to observe and report but to interact and prepare. A metamorphosis had begun, and Operation: Dulce hummed with the newfound frequency of their daring, a tone set not by the earthly

their voice slicing through the buzz of activity. "Control may be an illusion when facing an intelligence that literally writes its own rules," they stated stoically, casting a watchful eye over the flurry of data.

"It's like it's learning to communicate," offered Sam Rivera from a nearby interface, their youthful energy boding a mix of awe and anxiety. "This gives talking to strangers' a whole new meaning."

Alex surveyed his team—each face a study in concentration, determination, and not a small measure of trepidation. "This might well be our first contact," he acknowledged, "And we need to be ready for whatever answers back."

Together, they stood on the edge of the unknown, forging humanity's response to a message from the heavens. The ensuing silence was palpable—a collective introspection about their role in this grand cosmic play, one that could rewrite human history.

[{"role": "user", "content": "-Goal-
Given a text document that is potentially relevant to this activity and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.
Use English as output language.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, use same language as input text. If English, capitalized the name.
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,category]
- entity_description: Comprehensive description of the entity's attributes and activities
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)

2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
- relationship_keywords: one or more high-level key words that summarize the overarching nature of the relationship, focusing on concepts or themes rather than specific details
Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_keywords><|><relationship_strength>)

3. Identify high-level key words that summarize the main concepts, themes, or topics of the entire text. These should capture the overarching ideas present in the document.
Format the content-level key words as ("content_keywords"<|><high_level_keywords>)

4. Return output in English as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.

5. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
Example 1:

Entity_types: [person, technology, mission, organization, location]
Text:
while Alex clenched his jaw, the buzz of frustration dull against the backdrop of Taylor's authoritarian certainty. It was this competitive undercurrent that kept him alert, the sense that his and Jordan's shared commitment to discovery was an unspoken rebellion against Cruz's narrowing vision of control and order.

Then Taylor did something unexpected. They paused beside Jordan and, for a moment, observed the device with something akin to reverence. "If this tech can be understood..." Taylor said, their voice quieter, "It could change the game for us. For all of us."

The underlying dismissal earlier seemed to falter, replaced by a glimpse of reluctant respect for the gravity of what lay in their hands. Jordan looked up, and for a fleeting heartbeat, their eyes locked with Taylor's, a wordless clash of wills softening into an uneasy truce.

It was a small transformation, barely perceptible, but one that Alex noted with an inward nod. They had all been brought here by different paths

Text: preferred casing material is corrosion-resistant stainless-steel or similar material provides
corrosion protection. The casing minimum wall thickness shall be 6.2 cm (¼ inch). The casing
must be round, straight, free of irregularities and seamless (cast, with no rolled seams). The
total length of the borehole casing shall be made up of sections of any standard length, but
minimum length of sections should be 3 m. Casing string must be made of the same type
(diameter, wall thickness, and composition) of casing section for its total depth.
Before proceeding with drilling the contractor must notify the Commission in writing with
dimensions of the chosen casing. Threaded casing joints using BTC (buttress-threaded
connections) are preferred. All threaded joints should be coated with joint compound and
tightened using sufficient torque. A torque of 1000 foot-pounds is recommended. Any casing
that meets these specifications is acceptable.
Immediately prior to cementing, a turbulent flow of clear water and a cleaning solution shall be
circulated down the casing and up the annulus to clean out any mud and debris that is present to
secure a good cement bond. The casing strings shall be supported approximately 5 m (15 feet)
above the bottom of the hole during cementing of the casing.
3.3.4 Cementation and grouting
The Contractor has the flexibility of selecting a preferred cementation method that will
completely bond the casing string to the rock walls over its entire depth with no voids or
shrinkage. For example, cementation can be accomplished through the casing using a cement
shoe and plunger method, cementation can be done via external grout tubes in the annulus
between the casing and host rock where the casing string is sealed by a welded plate at the
bottom. However, the preferred cementation process is to pump cement grout through the
interior of the casing using a plunger and cement shoe and flush the full volume up the annular
space between the exterior casing wall and the rock to the surface. The cement shoe and collar
7

[Page 27]
will form the cement plug at the bottom of the casing. Typical cement grout composition uses
cement, sand, bentonite (clay), water, and an expansive additive to prevent shrinkage upon
drying.
The borehole shall be cemented from bottom to top. The following procedure is recommended.
Cement slurry with sufficient volume to fill the annulus with at least 25% excess shall be
pumped into the casing. Then a latch down plug shall be inserted into the casing and washed
down with clear water. When the plug reaches the baffle, normally 1,000 pounds per square
inch of pressure should force the latching nose of the plug into the baffle and lock it in place.
Once the plug is seated, all pressure must be released to check for zero back-flow, this will
prove that the one-way valves are holding. When zero back-flow is obtained, the cement slurry
shall be allowed to cure for 24 hours under no pressure before performing any activities that
could disturb the bond, such as blowing or bailing the borehole dry of water or proceeding with
the acceptance tests.
After 24 hours, the casing shall be scraped, brushed, and emptied of all fluids and loose solids.
If the cement level drops in the annular space between the pipe and the hole, additional cement
slurry may be added around the casing directly from the surface. The level of the cement grout
in the annular space between the casing and the rock wall must be monitored during the
hardening process. If the level drops, additional cement grout must be added around the casing
from the top using small feed pipes if necessary.
3.3.5 Construction of borehole well-head and enclosure
A concrete pad around the top of the borehole casing (“well-head”) with a thickness of 10 to
20cm and approximately 1m x 1m in area (if square) or approximately 1mdiameter (if circular)
is to be constructed. In addition, a housing or enclosure around the top of the well-head for
protection against the environment shall be built. This enclosure will provide shelter from
water, snow, theft, small animals, etc. A simple inverted “bin” with a rubber or synthetic gasket,
bolted to the concrete pad, will suffice. The pad must include an L- or U-shaped conduit for the
entry of the signal cable that will be protected under the well-head enclosure.
3.3.6 Site remediation
The Contractor will take care of property and removal of debris from the site. Care shall be
taken at all times during the work described in these specifications to prevent undue damage to
the property on which the work is being performed. After completion of the work described in
this specification, the area shall be thoroughly cleaned of all residual material resulting from the
drilling operation or equipment. The surface shall be free of drilling mud, cuttings, scrap
equipment, foliage, packing, and related items. The surface shall be smoothed to its original
contours with all vehicle ruts covered.
3.4 Acceptance tests.
The Contractor will perform a series of acceptance tests as described below.
3.4.1 Verticality Test:
A final verticality test must be performed in the interior of the casing after cementation.
Measurements should be made of the deviation from the vertical at 15 m depth intervals and at
the base of the borehole.
8

[Page 28]
3.4.2 Leak Test:
The final cased and cemented borehole must be checked against leaks by completely filling the
casing with water and recording that the water level has not dropped after 24 hours. The

[{"role": "user", "content": "-Goal-
Given a text document that is potentially relevant to this activity and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.
Use English as output language.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, use same language as input text. If English, capitalized the name.
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,category]
- entity_description: Comprehensive description of the entity's attributes and activities
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)

2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
- relationship_keywords: one or more high-level key words that summarize the overarching nature of the relationship, focusing on concepts or themes rather than specific details
Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_keywords><|><relationship_strength>)

3. Identify high-level key words that summarize the main concepts, themes, or topics of the entire text. These should capture the overarching ideas present in the document.
Format the content-level key words as ("content_keywords"<|><high_level_keywords>)

4. Return output in English as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.

5. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1:

Entity_types: [person, technology, mission, organization, location]
Text:
while Alex clenched his jaw, the buzz of frustration dull against the backdrop of Taylor's authoritarian certainty. It was this competitive undercurrent that kept him alert, the sense that his and Jordan's shared commitment to discovery was an unspoken rebellion against Cruz's narrowing vision of control and order.

Then Taylor did something unexpected. They paused beside Jordan and, for a moment, observed the device with something akin to reverence. "If this tech can be understood..." Taylor said, their voice quieter, "It could change the game for us. For all of us."

The underlying dismissal earlier seemed to falter, replaced by a glimpse of reluctant respect for the gravity of what lay in their hands. Jordan looked up, and for a fleeting heartbeat, their eyes locked with Taylor's, a wordless clash of wills softening into an uneasy truce.

It was a small transformation, barely perceptible, but one that Alex noted with an inward nod. They had all been brought here by different paths
################

11. The final cased borehole has to admit a test gauge, to be provided by the Contractor, of

12. The final cased borehole must be watertight.
13. The borehole must be left dry after the leak test and sealed with a removable cap.
3.2 Contractor Responsibilities during Borehole Drilling
a) The Contractor shall be prepared for any situation that might occur. The contractor must
have sufficient equipment and supplies on location, including surface conductor and surface
casing, to case off any surface alluvium that might be present during drilling. The
Contractor must have sufficient lost circulation material on location to meet any demands.
The Contractor must have sufficient cement on hand and a proper pump in order to cement
off any loss of circulation zones. If the Drilling Contractor is in an area where cement
service companies are readily available, then a cement-service sub-contractor may be used.
In order for the borehole to be cemented from bottom to top satisfactorily as specified, each
water or lost circulation zone shall be plugged or cemented off or sealed with lost
circulation material before continuing drilling the borehole.
b) The Contractor will take care of property and removal of debris from the site. Care shall
be taken at all times during the work described in these specifications to prevent undue
damage to the property on which the work is being performed. After completion of the
work described in this specification, the area shall be thoroughly cleaned of all residual
material resulting from the drilling operation or equipment. The surface shall be free of
drilling mud, cuttings, scrap equipment, foliage, packing, and related items. The surface
shall be smoothed to its original contours with all vehicle ruts covered.
c) The Contractor will keep the Commission fully informed of the progress, or any problems
encountered, during the drilling or cementation process. Severe problems encountered
during drilling may change the planned location of the borehole. Such a situation must be
discussed immediately with the Commission. Deviations from target depths, or from the
exact location, can be made as an emergency if appropriate geological justifications are
discovered during drilling, and if the Commission is notified of the proposed changes and
accepts the proposed changes.
d) The finished borehole must comply with the tests indicated in these TOR. The
Contractor shall be responsible for ensuring that the finished borehole complies with the
acceptance test and requirements of verticality, diameter size, water-tightness, and quality of
cementation indicated in these TOR.
3.3 Description of the Work to be performed.
3.3.1 Preparation
The Contractor shall select an appropriate site for the drilling inside the station premises. The
exact location to be approved by the Commission before drilling starts. The Contractor will
prepare the site, including leveling, and the removal of debris, stones, objects, heavy growths of
vegetation or other materials undesirable for the drilling. The Contractor shall transport all
drilling equipment to the site with their own resources.
6

[Page 26]
3.3.2 Drilling
The borehole will be drilled using an appropriately sized drill bit for the final choice of casing
diameters, while allowing for sufficient annular space to securely grout the casing to the rock
formation. It is recommended that the borehole be drilled between 21.6 cm (8.5 inches) and
26.7 cm (10-5/8 inches). Drilling should be done by the most cost-efficient method, which is
usually with a tri-cone rotary drill bit. Samples of drill cuttings (normal rock detritus created by
the rotary drilling and floated to the surface in drilling mud), should be collected at about 5-
meter intervals for each borehole for use in the description of the geological make-up within
each borehole. This information will be required as part of the drilling report.
The vertical offset or drift for the deep borehole shall not exceed 2.5 degrees from true vertical
measurement at any point from the top to the bottom of the cased hole. It is suggested that this
be achieved as follows: While drilling, pull-down pressure on the Kelly should be avoided. Drill
pressure should be provided solely by the weight of the drill collars. An appropriate device,
such as a Baker Tool TOTCO Recorder shall be used during the drilling to ensure that the hole
is not drifting from vertical.
When total depth of the borehole is reached at the proper diameter, circulation shall be
maintained for approximately one (1) hour to assure that the hole is free of cuttings and cavings.
3.3.3 Casing
The borehole shall be cased to its total depth using seamless steel casing, with standard threads
and collars, leaving an inner diameter between 14.5 cm (5.69 inches), and 17.8 cm (7.0 inches).
The preferred casing material is corrosion-resistant stainless-steel or similar material provides
corrosion protection. The casing minimum wall thickness shall be 6.2 cm (¼ inch). The casing
must be round, straight, free of irregularities and seamless (cast, with no rolled seams). The
total length of the borehole casing shall be made up of sections of any standard length, but
minimum length of sections should be 3 m. Casing string must be made of the same type

Together, they stood on the edge of the unknown, forging humanity's response to a message from the heavens. The ensuing silence was palpable—a collective introspection about their role in this grand cosmic play, one that could rewrite human history.

[{"role": "user", "content": "-Goal-
Given a text document that is potentially relevant to this activity and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.
Use English as output language.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, use same language as input text. If English, capitalized the name.
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,category]
- entity_description: Comprehensive description of the entity's attributes and activities
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)

2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
- relationship_keywords: one or more high-level key words that summarize the overarching nature of the relationship, focusing on concepts or themes rather than specific details
Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_keywords><|><relationship_strength>)

3. Identify high-level key words that summarize the main concepts, themes, or topics of the entire text. These should capture the overarching ideas present in the document.
Format the content-level key words as ("content_keywords"<|><high_level_keywords>)

4. Return output in English as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.

5. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1:

Entity_types: [person, technology, mission, organization, location]
Text:
while Alex clenched his jaw, the buzz of frustration dull against the backdrop of Taylor's authoritarian certainty. It was this competitive undercurrent that kept him alert, the sense that his and Jordan's shared commitment to discovery was an unspoken rebellion against Cruz's narrowing vision of control and order.

Then Taylor did something unexpected. They paused beside Jordan and, for a moment, observed the device with something akin to reverence. "If this tech can be understood..." Taylor said, their voice quieter, "It could change the game for us. For all of us."

The underlying dismissal earlier seemed to falter, replaced by a glimpse of reluctant respect for the gravity of what lay in their hands. Jordan looked up, and for a fleeting heartbeat, their eyes locked with Taylor's, a wordless clash of wills softening into an uneasy truce.

It was a small transformation, barely perceptible, but one that Alex noted with an inward nod. They had all been brought here by different paths
################

OTHER INFORMATION
1. The Commission reserves the right to accept or reject bidder’s quotation, partially or entirely, and to annul this
procurement process at any time prior to award of the Purchase Order, without thereby incurring any liability to

4. The bidder’s price quotation shall be submitted in the English language, together with relevant technical literatures

8. From the deadline for submission of quotation until the written notification of award, no bidder shall contact the

clarification. Any effort to influence the Commission in its evaluation of the quotation(s) or its award decision
shall result in the rejection of the quotation.
9. The Commission shall evaluate the compliance of the quotations with the RFQ requirements. Subject to its
technical compliance, the quotations shall be examined for its contractual compliance and commercial
acceptability. Based on the mentioned evaluation, the Commission will determine the quotation which is the “least
costly technically acceptable”. Deviation, if any, from the Commission’s terms and conditions might be a factor in
the decision of award.
10. In case of an award, the following documents shall govern the Purchase Order and in case of discrepancies or

### Proposal Outline for RFQ Submission

**Date:** [Insert Date]

**From:** [Your Company Name]  
**To:** [Commission's Name]  
**Subject:** Proposal Submission for RFQ No. 2024-108  

---

#### Executive Summary
This proposal outlines our intentions and plans to fulfill the requirements set out in RFQ No. 2024-108, which focuses on services related to borehole rehabilitation and drilling. Our firm, [Your Company Name], has extensive experience in providing high-quality drilling and rehabilitation services that meet rigorous safety and technical standards.

---

#### Company Profile
- **Business Name:** [Your Company Name]  
- **Address:** [Your Company Address]  
- **Contact Information:** [Your Email and Phone Number]  
- **Experience:** We have been in the drilling and rehabilitation industry for [X years] and have successfully completed numerous similar projects. Our past performance can be verified with several client references.

---

### Compliance with RFQ Requirements
1. **Financial, Technical, and Production Capability:**
   - We assure compliance with the technical specifications outlined in the RFQ, demonstrating our ability to provide high-quality goods and services. 
   - Our financial capabilities have been demonstrated through previous projects where we managed budgets exceeding [insert amount].

2. **Quotation Submission:**
   - Our quotation will include detailed pricing, terms, and conditions compliant with the RFQ requirements, ensuring that all items requested are priced transparently and competitively.

3. **Bidder's Statement:**
   - Attached to this proposal is the Bidder's Statement, which confirms our qualifications and compliance with all required legal obligations to engage in contract interplay.

4. **Technical Specifications and Requirements:**
   - Our proposal addresses all outlined technical specifications in the RFQ, particularly regarding the rehabilitation process of existing boreholes and the drilling of new ones.
   - We propose to use high-early strength cement for sealing, ensuring effective water-tightness as designated in the technical terms.

5. **Compliance with Laws and Regulations:**
   - As stipulated, we acknowledge the need to comply with all counsel and laws governing drilling operations within Senegal, adhering strictly to environmental guidelines and safety standards.

---

### Methodology Overview

1. **Borehole Rehabilitation (LOT 1):**
   - **Preparation:**
     - Cleaning and inspection of the borehole using advanced camera technology.
     - Continuous monitoring throughout the pumping processes to evaluate the borehole's functionality.
   - **Rehabilitation Process:**
     - Application of cement to seal the borehole effectively against water ingress and ensure structural integrity.
     - Completion of leak tests to confirm the effectiveness of the sealing.

2. **Drilling a New Borehole (LOT 2):**
   - **Site Preparation:**
     - Careful selection of the drill site, including a comprehensive analysis of soil and groundwater.
   - **Drilling Process:**
     - Utilization of equipment that meets all established technical criteria, including the casing specifications and installation procedures.

3. **Testing and Inspection:**
   - Post-completion, we will conduct verticality, leak, and obstruction tests, adhering to the acceptance criteria specified within the RFQ.

---

### Budget
An itemized budget will be provided, detailing costs associated with each phase of the project, including labor, materials, and equipment necessary to execute the contract successfully. This budget will be transparent and reflective of the commitment to maintaining high standards at a competitive pricing structure.

---

### Conclusion
We are committed to delivering exceptional services aligned with the Commission's objectives concerning borehole rehabilitation and drilling. Our approach adheres to the outlined requirements in the RFQ, ensuring compliance with all technical and regulatory conditions. We are hopeful for the opportunity to partner with the Commission, contributing to the successful realization of this project.

---

**Attachments:**  
1. Bidder’s Statement  
2. Company Profile  
3. Detailed Quotation  
4. Previous Project References  

Thank you for your consideration of our proposal. We look forward to the opportunity to discuss our submission in more detail.

---

**Contact Person:**  
[Your Full Name]  
[Your Position]  
[Your Company Name]  
[Your Direct Phone and Email]  

---

This proposal accurately incorporates the specific elements required from the RFQ and showcases our preparedness to undertake the project successfully.

## Proposal for RFQ No. 2024-108: Borehole Rehabilitation and Drilling

**Submitted to:**  
The Commission

**Submitted by:**  
[Your Company Name]  
[Address]  
[Contact Information]  

### 1. Introduction

This proposal responds to RFQ No. 2024-108 issued by the Commission for the Borehole Rehabilitation and Drilling project located in Senegal. Our company, [Your Company Name], specializes in the rehabilitation and installation of boreholes, with extensive experience meeting compliance standards and project specifications outlined by governing bodies.

### 2. Objectives

The primary objectives of this proposal are:
- To deliver high-quality borehole rehabilitation services compliant with the Terms of Reference (TOR).
- To execute the drilling of a new borehole and ensure the provision of Goods as specified.
- To maintain ongoing communication with the Commission and provide regular progress reports throughout the project.

### 3. Scope of Work

As outlined in the RFQ and the Terms of Reference, our proposed scope of work includes:

- **Borehole Rehabilitation (LOT 1):**
    - Cleaning and sealing of existing boreholes.
    - Performing inspections and tests as required by the Commission.
    - Submitting a Drilling Report upon completion detailing procedures and outcomes.

- **New Borehole Drilling (LOT 2):**
    - Drilling a new borehole intended to house seismic instruments.
    - Ensuring casing specifications comply with the outlined technical guidelines.
    - Managing all necessary materials and logistics for construction.

### 4. Project Management

We will implement a robust project management framework that involves:
- Assigning a dedicated project manager to oversee activities.
- Utilizing experienced teams to ensure timely execution and compliance with safety regulations.
- Engaging local resources and supporting the community in the process.

### 5. Compliance and Quality Assurance

We understand the importance of compliance with local laws in Senegal. Our procedures ensure adherence to:
- The CTBTO General Conditions of Contract.
- Specific laws and ordinances relevant to the execution of this project.
- Insurance requirements covering all risks associated with our activities.

### 6. Financial Proposal

**Detailed pricing:**  
- *LOT 1: Rehabilitation of Existing Borehole:*   
    - Cost per Unit: [Insert Pricing Here]  
    - Total Cost: [Insert Total Cost for Rehabilitation]
  
- *LOT 2: Drilling of New Borehole:*   
    - Cost per Unit: [Insert Pricing Here]  
    - Total Cost: [Insert Total Cost for Drilling]  
  
- **Warranty Period:** We provide a minimum warranty of 24 months on all Goods and services rendered during this contract. 

### 7. Documentation

Attached to this proposal, you will find:
- The Bidder’s Statement confirming our qualifications.
- The Vendor Profile Form.
- Evidence of our Audited Annual Report and Accounts.
- Insurance certificates covering all aspects as required by the RFQ.
- Any miscellaneous supporting documents requested in the RFQ.

### 8. Conclusion

We are enthusiastic about the opportunity to work with the Commission on this critical project. We are committed to delivering exceptional services and ensuring compliance with all specified requirements, while also maintaining clear communication throughout.

We appreciate your consideration of our proposal and look forward to the opportunity to discuss this further.

---

**Submitted on:** [Date]  
**Signature:**  
[Your Name]  
[Your Title]  
[Your Company]  

---

This proposal adheres to the requirements as outlined in the RFQ, addressing critical elements such as project management, compliance, financial capability, and documentation submission. We encourage revisions or additional requests for information to best meet the Commission's expectations.
